column4: If I create a partition without a mount point, will linux see it?
fdisk -l will see it, but to use it it will need to be mounted.
can I mount it from within linux once it's up and running?
yes, of course.
thanks!
anytime.
one more ?
sure
my x86 install of ubu wont see my keyboard. If I plug in an external key board (its a laptop) and I get in, can I fix the internal keyboard from within linux?
yes, what laptop?
AMD64 with an x86 install??
yes, several ubu experts have told me to do it this way...
that it would be better like that
it will cause all sorts of problems.
forum moderator told me this, some sort of media thing
I'll paste the URL
it's a vastly different architecture. send me the URL yep.
http://www.ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=50553&highlight=antinomy
you're right, you were advised to use the x86 version. odd..
it will run, but i thought it would have been good awful slow for packages compiled for 64bit
right.. well anyway, this is unrelated to the keyboard problem, which should be trivial to fix once booted.
